title: Space Transportation Assets Valorisation in Europe

author: Michel Pons, Centre Nationale d’Etudes Spatiales - CNES

segmentation: Well, ladies and gentlemen, good morning.
I'm very pleased of this brief introduction by Mr Peter Velasco, because I think I will directly answer to one of his wishes expressed here.
Then just.
Here, so I'm going to talk about this state project.
Is my mouse.
Here, sorry, I want to talk about this state project which is a project which takes place within the 7th Framework Program of European Commission and which deals with the space transportation.

You know that Ness is the French space agency and it has two strong legs which are satellite technical center in Toulouse and Launchers Technical Center in every.
And I'm part of the Vice Directorate from every Center for Launchers.
And I will split my presentation in three parts.
1st A wise Dave what is and what are the objectives then?
How is organized the project and then you will see why I have to present space transportation technical need.
So why Steve?

Steve is the result of political wheel in Europe, which relies mainly on the Lisbon St E which itself was first established on the Lisbon Strategy in in 2000 and the will was to bring Europe to be the most competitive and dynamic in the world by 2010.
And this has been increased in by the Lisbon's Treaty.
By the end of last year.
In which coming to my spot, which is the space transportation and the space activities space has become a shared competence in between EU and Member States.
So this means that.
There is a legal basis for shared competence, and this opens the way to a real European Space policy.
And in which the autonomous European access to space is being is being a priority.
Enough.
And the.
A little more precision on this is that the in May 2007.
That's the first time when the the European space policy became a reality.
By having a few 2 main points, the first being the fact that EU and as a Member States.
Have all something voice are represented.
Administer real level and the second point is that there was a result.
Whoops, choose me.
This goes too fast.
There was a resolution adopted.
In order.
Not touching.
In order to increase coordination.
In order to outline outline strategic guidelines for Europe, European future activities and the will to maintain independent, reliable and cost effective access to space.
And last point which was mentioned in this resolution is that Europe needs to take advantage in a coherent way of the launcher assets under its control.
So this.
Will.

Led to the proposal of this project, called the Stave, which goal is to identify the existing skills and commitment competences in the domain of the space transportation and within the 12 new Member States and this for the benefit of the European Space Community.
By valorizing these skills and making them participate too.
European Commission projects is a project and national agencies projects.
And I will show you how we do this.
This project now.

Has been proposed in June 2007 in the first space call, which was the first call including Space Trend transportation in the in the whole history of the frame programs, and this project has been accepted and the grant agreement is being established.
Did you rayshon of this project will be two years and the kickoff meeting will take place next week in Paris.
So how shall we?
How is organized this project?

Agencies, if you look at the chart here is the contribution of these three agencies to the space transportation activities in Europe, including ASR, prosessor programs, and national programs.
So these three agencies are representative for knowing what are the main needs and this was expected to be the most efficient to be a few covering the.
Most of the.
Programs this project addresses the 12 new Member States which are drawn here and G objective is to of course identify and valorize.
As I said, the research centers, universities, research institutes, small and medium enterprises and industry.
All those whose skills can be useful for space transportation.
This save project.
Has a good timing and a step by step approach because this is what was expected to make it reliable and robust.

What we expect in terms of impact is a short term impact after identification to make those skills participate into research programs, and this fits with the space road map, European Space Road map, which exists when we have research to be prepared now for having a medium term demonstraters.

In terms of space transportation, of course, and so if there is some research which is done in collaboration from here to, let's say 2012, then we we can introduce these skills into demonstrators activities and being part of demonstrator activities by 2015.
This enables these new skills to be part of large developments which might take place by 2020.
25 Who knows, we cannot have this precision right now, so this is the.
So the the goal of.
The this state project.
No.
How are we organized to do this?
First we have to reach in form.
And in order to do this, first we want to contact the most possible entities in within the new Member States and then we have to set up an efficient network.
Once we have this network which.
Which allows us to contact all the possible end entities.
We will present the space transportation needs in terms of technical needs in detail, through workshops and arouse interests, and these workshops will be open.
It will be.
I don't know exactly what's what will be if it will be one day workshop or two day workshops in which there will be exchanges in between the participants and.
The state project.
In order to be able to get information and to to inform first these entities and getting from big get back information about capacities existing capacities.
Then we will evaluate these skills and as a final result we will proposed.
We will propose direct link in between each of these entities.
And the existing programs, but.
I think this is my next slide, no?
I'm going to say it later.
I forgot this light.
Sorry.

What are the the networks before we go to the end to the conclusion this is a slide illustrating the network.
How it works.
We cannot reach directly all the entities, so we want to rely on on existing networks such as embassies, space agencies.

And these.
Dots there on the right are the people which we would like to participate to.
The workshops in which we will present the technical needs.

The four slovania, for example.

If I remember well, I I'm not sure.

To confirm the validity and the strength of the declared skills becauses it's so it's very close to we were discussing this previously with my friend over here and it's very close to their harmonization process which already exists in Western Europe.
And here what we want to do is to enlarge it and to take the real existing skills.
So that there will be paperwork.

Now I'll say very briefly a few words about what do I mean by technical needs.
And.
Technical needs is taken in a very wide sense.
Technical needs is first all lifetime phases of a project of a launcher project starting from research and you have here a drawing from University of Rome for flow into a nozzle.
You have technological development within users, cavitation.
For example you have demonstraters development with here.
Demonstrator of turbopump.
Design predesigned for future projects and here you have two drawings of things which could maybe one day exist.
You have a fuel cell prototype.
Four and you see also bench testing and it leads also to production and exploitation.
This being the present oriented 5 booster.
So the technical skills which are requested are in all lifetime faces.

Of the project there are also in all the technical domains of the space transportation with system integration, liquid propulsion, solid propulsion, electrical propulsion, dealing with propellants, liquid cryogenics, non toxic, high energetic.
Dealing also also with dynamic Syro dynamics and high frequency low frequency structures materials here heat resistant you have here some pictures that showed the different domains with the tiles.
Combustion chamber cooling system defects here injection in the combustion chamber materials aerodynamics you have ignition simulation.
And you have that's ground operation for so using JNA down on the right.
So all these domains are concerned with our value.
Nation.
And all means also our concerns, which is simulation bench testing, flight testing and production tools.
And you have here a few illustrations from simulation of acoustics on the.
Launchpad to this is a PhD in Germany bench.
This is the Vinci engine testing within the FFELP program now.
And production also tools.
So you see that the technical needs that we will express through this workshop will be quite complete and we are trying to really make an effort to join the efforts of.
Capacities of the 12 new Member States for being really for really being part of the space effort for maintaining.
Wrong Europe.

And of course there is a website for informing people and we will put there most of the activities and people can join us for participating and regime registering to the workshops which will take place.
Thank you very much.
